New Records: LeBron James broke Michael Jordan's record for most 30-point games in NBA history with 563 games
Key Match Events: LeBron James hit a fadeaway jumper over Onyeka Okongwu to surpass Michael Jordan's record
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win, and also talked about his idolization of Michael Jordan
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers won for the eighth time in their last 11 games, and moved six games over.500 for the first time since Nov. 19
LeBron James is averaging 27.4 points on 53.7 percent shooting (44.7 percent from three), 8.1 assists and 5.8 rebounds per game in eight starts since returning on Dec. 15
The Lakers will play the Houston Rockets on Sunday before traveling to Dallas to the play the Mavericks on Tuesday
Others: LeBron James is the more efficient scorer of Michael Jordan with a 50.6 field-goal percentage, compared to 49.7 percent for Jordan
